DataElement.preferredDefinition: Descriptive reason for the lab test as defined by the sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microbiology Specimen Domain Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen.

Property.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Microbiology Specimen Domain Laboratory Procedure Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Reason
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exposure in a local area, outside of a hospital setting, where individuals with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection (COVID-19) have been reported.

Concepts.definition: Exposure in a local area, outside of a hospital setting, where individuals with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection (COVID-19) have been reported.

PermissibleValues.value: HOUSEHOLD CONTACT WITH SARS COV-2 POSITIVE INDIVIDUAL
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exposure to an individual that lives in the same residence and that has tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Concepts.longName: Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual
Concepts.definition: Exposure to an individual that lives in the same residence and that has tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

PermissibleValues.value: NON-HOUSEHOLD CONTACT WITH SARS COV-2 POSITIVE INDIVIDUAL
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non-Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non-Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exposure to an individual that does not live in the same residence but has tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Concepts.longName: Non-Household Contact with SARS-CoV-2 Positive Individual
Concepts.definition: Exposure to an individual that does not live in the same residence but has tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

PermissibleValues.value: ROUTINE TEST PRIOR TO ANTI-CANCER TREATMENT
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Routine COVID-19 Test Prior to Anti-cancer Treatment

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Routine COVID-19 Test Prior to Anti-cancer Treatment
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testing for Sars-CoV-2 virus or antibodies against the virus in an asymptomatic individual, prior to them receiving anti-cancer treatment.

Concepts.longName: Routine COVID-19 Test Prior to Anti-cancer Treatment
Concepts.definition: Testing for Sars-CoV-2 virus or antibodies against the virus in an asymptomatic individual, prior to them receiving anti-cancer treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A finding indicating that an individual has been exposed to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Microbiology Specimen Domain Laboratory Procedure Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Reason
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to microbiology specimen.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
